content.description: Boulder to the ledge.  Crux is climbing the slab without the letters as nubs for your feet.
content.location: Look for the deeply carved initials, and you will see an obvious bouldering location.

content.description: The beginning is the crux.  Love the exposure looking down.  Easier than it looks, but it is still difficult enough that a fall is possible if you don't climb it with intention.
content.protection: Bouldering pad at the base of the rocks or top rope setup by anchoring to the roots and the trees with 50' runners.
content.location: When you locate the slab, the start is on the rock pile to the right.  It will provide a straight route to the top.  You can hike down the trail from the top.

content.description: An awesome 30ft of decently protected bouldering with a sloped landing following the problem up for 15 ft. There is also an obvious lower left extension that would clock in at V9-V11. Start under the roof on obvious crimps. Make a big first move to a slot jug on the right side of the roof. Instead of exiting right on the tall face, trend left on crimps and sidepulls keeping the slabby landing underneath you. Move into the large and solid huecos on the left and then pull on the large chickenheads to top out.
content.location: Devil's Slide. The first 45 degree roof right off the trail.

content.description: This is the slab area to the left of Mushroom boulder.  All day sun.
